text: I honestly don't understand the bad reviews over this place. The service is quite fast and the food is great. I would personally not reorder any kind of chicken or beef because it wasn't that good.

Average all you can eat sushi. Watch out because the waiters make a lot of mistakes in the order, so you might get the wrong dishes. Choices are limited and just normal. The only good thing about that place is you can bring your own wine and it's spacious. You can reserve in advance.

I've been there over half a dozen times and every time, the food is great and the service is good. Sure, it's not the best sushi in Montreal, but this location ranks pretty high for me for an all you can eat place (and i have been to a LOT). The only thing is it's pricier than other AYCE  sushi where you get the same type of quality. I always end up paying around 30$. If you can get a booth, get one because they are really nice :)

Went to eat on a Friday night, the service was above average with enough staff to fulfill all our needs. 

The problem is with the food... You can tell it not fresh. The chicken and seafood was bland and had no taste. 

I understand it is an all you can eat restaurant, but I expected better (comparing it to other Kandas I have been to, like on Decarie).

Excellent resto sushi à volonté. Service assez rapide, malgré deux serveuses seulement!

Sushis savoureux et variété intéressante.
I cannot comment on the actual food, since we basically were shown to a table and then promptly forgotten. If there is no service, I don't think it is worth staying.

Pour ceux qui me connaissent, vous savez que j'adore les sushis. Des chers et des pas chers..en autant que je ne tombe pas malade. 

Bref, j'étais invité pour un anniversaire au Kanda Sushi de St-Léonard. La fameuse chaine de restaurant  de All you can eat Sushi, dont je n'avais jamais été. Elle est situé aux abords du fameux Carrefour Langelier.

Mon intérêt d'aller là était plus ou moins élevé, par contre, quand on m'a annoncé que c'était un KANDA PLUS, ce qui voulait dire un APPORTEZ VOTRE VIN, j'ai commencé à m'en réjouir de plus en plus. 

Dès que nous sommes arrivé, nous avions le choix de sushi et de mets variables dans des feuilles où nous devions cocher et choisir les quantité. Les serveurs sont venu nous voir plusieurs fois pour vérifié si nous avions des questions. Ils ont été très vite à nous servir de l'eau et nous amener des seaux pour les bouteilles de vino. Une fois la commande passé, les sushis sont arrivés extrêmement vite. Je ne sais pas s'ils étaient fait d'avance, mais ils étaient délicieux. Certes, ce n'est pas les plus "on point" mais un gros 7/10 en général pour les différents maki que j'ai goûté. 

Pour ce qui est de la bouffe, j'ai adoré la crevette tempura, calmars sel et poivre et le pad thai a été le plat favori de notre table. J'ai goûté le tartare, c'était bon, mais c'était plus des morceaux d'avocats avec par dessus du saumon frais avec un coulis d'huile de sésame et des grains de sésame. 

Nous étions un des derniers groupes à quitter. Nous n'avons pas senti le sentiment de pression qu'il fallait quitter OPC. Bref, pour 40$ je suis resté satisfaite, et c'est sûre que j'y retourne. Personnel super amical et courtois, la rapidité du resto et la propreté sont un plus pour ce resto. Viva los sushis

I have been to kanda plus 3 or 4 times and i will definitely go back. Its a good AYCE and BYOW restaurant. They don't have many choices on their menu for lunch but for dinner they do. The service is good, the staff is polite and friendly. Of course, don't expect it to be the best AYCE sushis restaurant in Montréal, but you should give it try.

Service: Careless service. Sloppy. 1st order is served at a normal rate. They dont really care if you order a 2nd time. Takes ages to arrive. No reference as to which name means what and the servers dont explain if asked. 
Food: food is good. Liked everything i ate. 2thumbs up. But i think they should introduce some desserts for lunch. The amount of item is less compared to other sushi buffets.
Ambience: more like a mcdonalds vibe. Chaotic and noisy. Its fine if you dont mind the noise, only looking to eat and unlike me dont care about the entire experience when you go out.
Free parking is a bonus.

Kanda is a chain of sushi restaurants in the Montreal area.  This location opened a short while ago and it is evident in the disjointed service.  

The server did not bring wasabi and when asked for it, the wasabi was dark green and dried out as was the ginger. Not a good start.  

The food was okay, but not at the same level as other Kandas.  

They will do fine in time, but this team needs practice and must understand you cannot serve wasabi that is not fresh.  It makes one wonder about the fish.

Time to bring your A-game. Hope to give a better review next time around Kanda Langelier.
